trans-unit.source: Represents an ordered collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> objects.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref> class using the elements in the specified <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The collection whose elements are copied to the new <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> to this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The gesture to add to the collection.
0, if the operation was successful (note that this is not the index of the added item).
the collection is read-only.
the gesture is `null`.
Adds the elements of the specified <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> to the end of this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The collection of items to add to the end of this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The collection is read-only.
The collection to add is `null`.
Removes all elements from the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The collection is read only.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> is in the collection.
The gesture to locate in the collection.
**true** if the gesture is in the collection; otherwise, **false**.
Copies all of the items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref> to the specified one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
An array into which the collection is copied.
The index position in the inputGestures at which copying begins.
inputGestures is a `null`.
index is less than 0.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> items in this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The number of gestures in the collection.
Gets an enumerator that iterates through this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The enumerator for this collection.
Searches for the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> in this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The gesture to locate in the collection.
The index of the first occurrence of value, if found; otherwise, -1.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> into this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref> at the specified index.
Index at which to insert inputGesture.
The gesture to insert.
inputGesture is `null`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
If the collection is read-only, <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection.IsFixedSize%2A> is **true**.
**true** if the collection has a fixed size; otherwise, **false**.
The default value is **false**.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref> is read-only.
The default value is **false**.
**true** if the collection read-only; otherwise, **false**.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe).
<xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection.SyncRoot%2A> can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
**true** if the collection is thread-safe; otherwise, **false**.
The default value is **false**.
Gets or set the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> at the specified index.
The position in the collection.
The gesture at the specified index.
Removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> from this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The gesture to remove.
The collection is read-only.
The gesture is `null`.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGesture"></xref> at the specified index of this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The zero-based index of the gesture to remove.
index is less than 0.
Sets this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref> to read-only.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to this <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
A zero-based <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The first position in the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to receive the copied contents.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextEffectCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which to insert the <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputGestureCollection"></xref>.
